reviews.review:
I literally hate this game but I love it at the same time. The matchmaking system is a total garbage, there is a great chance that you will match with rank 7-8 killer when you are rank 15 or 16. Besides, I don't know if only I have this problem but I always face with the "UNKNOWN ERROR" at specific times when I try to play with my mates. However, if you look to the big picture and ignore the bugs and server problems, you will easily enjoy the game. 
8.50/10

Great game, played originally on console but don't tell anybody ;)

This game is incredibly fun, and conceptually an incredibly creative concept. As someone who is downright horrified of the horror/thriller genre, this game took me 5 years to muster the courage back up to play. And upon returning and with the assistance of friends to play with, what a fun experience that was. Even 50 hours into the game, and I still get frightened by certain things (looking at you Myers) which is honestly great to know the magic of this game's entire vibe can never truly be diminished. That doesn't make it perfect, but for what it is and what it provides, it's pretty on par with your typical MOBA/Hero Shooter/Online PvP type of game.

The gameplay on either side (Survivor/Killer) is unique and a totally different experience. To play Survivor with friends is awesome, and to play Killer on your own and feel like a Cat chasing 4 grease-covered Mice is can be as satisfying as it can be frustrating. For starters, the gameplay is truly fun for both sides, but what determines "fun" on either is totally different. And on the other side of things, there is a lot of toxicity that can stem from (almost always) survivors who innately develop an almost bully-like "us (4) vs them (1)" mentality, which can sometimes become evident in teabagging, or the unfortunately all-too-common verbal abuse post-game. There is nothing quite as demoralizing as playing a new Killer or just having a bad game and getting verbally abused by up to 4 people, some of which ironically will have nonsense like "be kind to others :)" in their steam bio.

If you decide to turn off chat and experience the game pretty much exclusively to how you want to- the simple yet thrilling feelings of slipping away from the killer or outwitting them around the corner or in a locker, OR, finally catching a very slippery survivor or executing them with a momento mori, are just a few of what make this game rewarding to play on either side.

The Art in this game is fantastic, as is the audio work, and virtually all of the non-guest Killer designs are top of the line in terms of both visual and gameplay design. They know their archetypes well, and while not every killer will be your cup of tea, there are bound to be several with gameplay that makes you really feel like that specific monster- further enhanced by some great skins (and some pretty boring ones too admittedly) to let you customize how you want to look.

For survivors, they cleverly use a system that (eventually) effectively allows you to play whomever you want. From the slew of original characters to the handful of guest characters like Bill from L4D, Steve Harrington and Nancy Wheeler from Stranger Things, and Ash Williams from the Evil Dead franchise. While all survivors offer 4 unique perks of their own, with enough gameplay (or through a special shop system that can only be purchased with in-game currency) you can eventually find yourself play whomever you want with any combination of perks across all characters. Given such a thing could theoretically take an absurdly long time, it feels more like an afterthought than an intended design choice. I imagine it was designed to prevent meta perks from causing a survivor team to be potentially filled with 4 of the same character in top level play.

So, in summary- If you like the horror genre, or enjoy asymmetric online pvp, don't mind the freemium staples like gameplay "passes", premium and freemium currencies, and a lot of farming to reach the "real" gameplay experience, then given all of its flaws regarding toxic gameplay and player behaviours, you'll enjoy this game, as those flaws are still made up for with a fun player experience, and new content added regularly. As of the writing this, we are very close to a Resident Evil Killer reveal!
